subsections.title: Contest Exchanges
subsections.label: subsec:contest-exchanges
prompts: Explain the concept of contesting in amateur radio, focusing on its purpose and how it differs from other operating activities like net operations or public service events.

Describe the proper procedure for contacting another station during a contest, emphasizing the importance of sending only the minimum information needed for proper identification and the contest exchange.
Define what a grid locator is and explain its significance in amateur radio, particularly in the context of contesting and geographic location identification.
